meanings.definition: An addition or supplement to a will.
meanings.sent1: She added codicils to her will to include her new grandchild.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer carefully reviewed the codicils attached to the will.
meanings.sent3: The codicils in the will made sure her favorite cat would inherit her toy collection.
meanings.sent4: The codicils in the will were like colorful bookmarks, adding new chapters to her legacy.
meanings.sent5: The codicils in the will sparkled with her wishes, shining brightly among the legal jargon.

meanings.definition: A clause in a legal document.
meanings.sent1: The codicils in the contract clarified the payment terms.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to read all the codicils in the agreement before signing.
meanings.sent3: The codicils in the legal paper seemed to dance around the main points.
meanings.sent4: The codicils in the document were like secret codes, unlocking hidden meanings.
meanings.sent5: The codicils in the paper whispered important details, waiting to be discovered.
